In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the code that solves your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str, ' ')
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
        elseif !isempty(result)
            result *= " "
        end
        result *= word
    end
    return result
end
```

You can use this function to wrap a string. For example, if you call `wrap_string("Hello world! This is a test.", 10)`, it will return `"Hello\nworld!\nThis\nis\na\ntest."`.
